alert.note: Alert for Blount (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 2:02PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Blount County through 245 PM CDT... At 201 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cleveland. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oneonta, Blountsville, Cleveland, Locust Fork, Susan Moore, Allgood, Fairview, Nectar, Rosa, Easley, Chamblees Mill, Fowler Spring and Hendrix. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
